page.title: 15Stockgrove Park School.
page.content: {Stockgrove Park House}is today used as a school by the I.L.E.A. There are 47 boys, 7/8 teachers, 8 child care assistants ,1 secretary(who's been there for 25 years)and 1 Headmaster (who's been there for 15 years) and 1 assistant gardener. In 1982 the school was worth 1/4 of a million pounds with 19 acres including the school. Before the building was a school it was a private house. It was built in 1929 and became a school in 1950.The field's which contain animals do not belong to Stockgrove but belong to Mr Avery and Mrs Woodhouse.There are 2 lodges beside the gates, one of which is empty the other is owned by Mrs Housley.The house was renovated before she moved in.The people before her bought a bit of the field behind the house so they have a bigger garden.
